abstract.text: A half-precision, floating-point value type.

topicSections.title: Converting with No Loss of Precision

abstract.text: These initializers result in
if the value passed can’t be represented without any loss of precision.
The sign of the floating-point value.
The least positive normal number.

value.
A Boolean value indicating whether the instance is subnormal.
The number of bits required to represent the value’s significand.
Rounds the value to an integral value using the specified rounding rule.
Replaces this value with the remainder of itself divided by the given

A half-precision, floating-point value type.
The raw encoding of the value’s exponent field.
Replaces this value with its square root, rounded to a representable value.

Positive infinity.

Creates an instance initialized to the specified integer value.
Creates a new instance that approximates the given value.

Creates a new value, if the given integer can be represented exactly.
